name: ntrclsbex
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0

stmt.origin: brfvimex(c0, c3, c1, c4, c2, w0)
stmt.pretty: brfvimex(c0, c3, c1, c4, c2, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wbr(c3, c1, c4))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wbr(c3, c1, c4))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
-| wi(w0, wbr(c3, c1, c4))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c2, c0))

comment: If (pseudo-)interior and (pseudo-)closure functions are related by the duality operator then the base set exists. (Contributed by RP, 21-May-2021.)
